hackathon-description-text: ShellHacks is a 36-hour hackathon at Florida International University (FIU), taking place the weekend of Friday, September 29 to Sunday, October 1st.
hackathon-eligibility: Must be 18 or older and a college student or recent graduate.
hackathon-rules: Whatever you present must have been created at the event and must follow the MLH Code of Conduct.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device
Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS
Best Domain Name Registered from Domain.com

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Design something to help solve a problem for minorities
Either use pre-existing code on github or create new solution
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: GE: Best IoT solution using their I0T Board

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Environmental friendly hack, help the ecosystem!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Microsoft Azure: Best use to promote inclusiveness

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Mixed swag pack of a water bottle, leather-bound notebook, speaker, shirt, and carry bag

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=PG6, E Campus Cir, Miami, FL 33174, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: The best three hacks will have a chance at taking their pick of choice from the prize pool!

hackathon-location-address: PG6, E Campus Cir, Miami, FL 33174, USA
hackathon-description-header: Learn about new technologies, create innovative projects, and share your work with the community!
